verses.arabic_text: ٱقۡتَرَبَتِ ٱلسَّاعَةُ وَٱنشَقَّ ٱلۡقَمَرُ
verses.translation: 1. The Hour has drawn near, and the moon has been cleft asunder (the people of Makkah requested Prophet Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم to show them a miracle, so he showed them the splitting of the moon).[2]

verses.arabic_text: وَإِن يَرَوۡاْ ءَايَةٗ يُعۡرِضُواْ وَيَقُولُواْ سِحۡرٞ مُّسۡتَمِرّٞ
verses.translation: 2. And if they see a sign, they turn away, and say: "This is continuous magic."

verses.arabic_text: وَكَذَّبُواْ وَٱتَّبَعُوٓاْ أَهۡوَآءَهُمۡۚ وَكُلُّ أَمۡرٖ مُّسۡتَقِرّٞ
verses.translation: 3. They belied (the Verses of Allâh - this Qur’ân), and followed their own lusts. And every matter will be settled (according to the kind of deeds: good deeds will take their doers to Paradise, and similarly evil deeds will take their doers to Hell).

verses.arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ جَآءَهُم مِّنَ ٱلۡأَنۢبَآءِ مَا فِيهِ مُزۡدَجَرٌ
verses.translation: 4. And indeed there has come to them news (in this Qur’ân) wherein there is (enough warning) to check (them from evil),

verses.arabic_text: حِكۡمَةُۢ بَٰلِغَةٞۖ فَمَا تُغۡنِ ٱلنُّذُرُ
verses.translation: 5. Perfect wisdom (this Qur’ân), but (the preaching of) warners benefit them not.

verses.arabic_text: فَتَوَلَّ عَنۡهُمۡۘ يَوۡمَ يَدۡعُ ٱلدَّاعِ إِلَىٰ شَيۡءٖ نُّكُرٍ
verses.translation: 6. So (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) withdraw from them. The Day that the caller will call (them) to a terrible thing.

verses.arabic_text: خُشَّعًا أَبۡصَٰرُهُمۡ يَخۡرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡأَجۡدَاثِ كَأَنَّهُمۡ جَرَادٞ مُّنتَشِرٞ
verses.translation: 7. They will come forth, with humbled eyes from (their) graves as if they were locusts spread abroad,

verses.arabic_text: مُّهۡطِعِينَ إِلَى ٱلدَّاعِۖ يَقُولُ ٱلۡكَٰفِرُونَ هَٰذَا يَوۡمٌ عَسِرٞ
verses.translation: 8. Hastening towards the caller. The disbelievers will say: "This is a hard Day."

verses.arabic_text: ۞ كَذَّبَتۡ قَبۡلَهُمۡ قَوۡمُ نُوحٖ فَكَذَّبُواْ عَبۡدَنَا وَقَالُواْ مَجۡنُونٞ وَٱزۡدُجِرَ
verses.translation: 9. The people of Nûh (Noah) denied (their Messenger) before them. They rejected Our slave, and said: "A madman!" and he was insolently rebuked and threatened.

verses.arabic_text: فَدَعَا رَبَّهُۥٓ أَنِّي مَغۡلُوبٞ فَٱنتَصِرۡ
verses.translation: 10. Then he invoked his Lord (saying): "I have been overcome, so help (me)!"

verses.arabic_text: فَفَتَحۡنَآ أَبۡوَٰبَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ بِمَآءٖ مُّنۡهَمِرٖ
verses.translation: 11. So We opened the gates of the heaven with water pouring forth.

verses.arabic_text: وَفَجَّرۡنَا ٱلۡأَرۡضَ عُيُونٗا فَٱلۡتَقَى ٱلۡمَآءُ عَلَىٰٓ أَمۡرٖ قَدۡ قُدِرَ
verses.translation: 12. And We caused springs to gush forth from the earth. So the waters (of the heaven and the earth) met for a matter predestined.

verses.arabic_text: وَحَمَلۡنَٰهُ عَلَىٰ ذَاتِ أَلۡوَٰحٖ وَدُسُرٖ
verses.translation: 13. And We carried him on a (ship) made of planks and nails,

verses.arabic_text: تَجۡرِي بِأَعۡيُنِنَا جَزَآءٗ لِّمَن كَانَ كُفِرَ
verses.translation: 14. Floating under Our Eyes: a reward for him who had been rejected!

verses.arabic_text: وَلَقَد تَّرَكۡنَٰهَآ ءَايَةٗ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ
verses.translation: 15. And indeed, We have left this as a sign. Then is there any that will remember (or receive admonition)?

verses.arabic_text: فَكَيۡفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
verses.translation: 16. Then how (terrible) was My Torment and My Warnings?

verses.arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ يَسَّرۡنَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ لِلذِّكۡرِ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ
verses.translation: 17. And We have indeed made the Qur’ân easy to understand and remember; then is there any one who will remember (or receive admonition)?

verses.arabic_text: كَذَّبَتۡ عَادٞ فَكَيۡفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
verses.translation: 18. ‘Âd (people) belied (their Prophet, Hûd); then how (terrible) was My Torment and My Warnings?

verses.arabic_text: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ رِيحٗا صَرۡصَرٗا فِي يَوۡمِ نَحۡسٖ مُّسۡتَمِرّٖ
verses.translation: 19. Verily, We sent against them a furious wind of harsh voice on a day of evil omen and continuous calamity.

verses.arabic_text: تَنزِعُ ٱلنَّاسَ كَأَنَّهُمۡ أَعۡجَازُ نَخۡلٖ مُّنقَعِرٖ
verses.translation: 20. Plucking out men as if they were uprooted stems of date-palms.

verses.arabic_text: فَكَيۡفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
verses.translation: 21. Then, how (terrible) was My Torment and My Warnings?

verses.arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ يَسَّرۡنَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ لِلذِّكۡرِ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ
verses.translation: 22. And We have indeed made the Qur’ân easy to understand and remember; then is there any that will remember (or receive admonition)?

verses.arabic_text: كَذَّبَتۡ ثَمُودُ بِٱلنُّذُرِ
verses.translation: 23. Thamûd (people also) belied the warnings.

verses.arabic_text: فَقَالُوٓاْ أَبَشَرٗا مِّنَّا وَٰحِدٗا نَّتَّبِعُهُۥٓ إِنَّآ إِذٗا لَّفِي ضَلَٰلٖ وَسُعُرٍ
verses.translation: 24. And they said: "A man, alone among us - shall we follow him? Truly then we should be in error and distress (or madness)!"

verses.arabic_text: أَءُلۡقِيَ ٱلذِّكۡرُ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۢ بَيۡنِنَا بَلۡ هُوَ كَذَّابٌ أَشِرٞ
verses.translation: 25. "Is it that the Reminder is sent to him [Prophet Sâlih عليه السلام] alone from among us? Nay, he is an insolent liar!"

verses.arabic_text: سَيَعۡلَمُونَ غَدٗا مَّنِ ٱلۡكَذَّابُ ٱلۡأَشِرُ
verses.translation: 26. Tomorrow they will come to know who is the liar, the insolent one!

verses.arabic_text: إِنَّا مُرۡسِلُواْ ٱلنَّاقَةِ فِتۡنَةٗ لَّهُمۡ فَٱرۡتَقِبۡهُمۡ وَٱصۡطَبِرۡ
verses.translation: 27. Verily, We are sending the she-camel as a test for them. So watch them [O Sâlih عليه السلام], and be patient!

verses.arabic_text: وَنَبِّئۡهُمۡ أَنَّ ٱلۡمَآءَ قِسۡمَةُۢ بَيۡنَهُمۡۖ كُلُّ شِرۡبٖ مُّحۡتَضَرٞ
verses.translation: 28. And inform them that the water is to be shared between (her and) them, each one’s right to drink being established (by turns).

verses.arabic_text: فَنَادَوۡاْ صَاحِبَهُمۡ فَتَعَاطَىٰ فَعَقَرَ
verses.translation: 29. But they called their comrade and he took (a sword) and killed (her).

verses.arabic_text: فَكَيۡفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
verses.translation: 30. Then, how (terrible) was My Torment and My Warnings?

verses.arabic_text: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ صَيۡحَةٗ وَٰحِدَةٗ فَكَانُواْ كَهَشِيمِ ٱلۡمُحۡتَظِرِ
verses.translation: 31. Verily, We sent against them a single Saihah (torment - awful cry), and they became like the stubble of a fold-builder.

verses.arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ يَسَّرۡنَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ لِلذِّكۡرِ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ
verses.translation: 32. And indeed, We have made the Qur’ân easy to understand and remember; then is there any that will remember (or receive admonition)?

verses.arabic_text: كَذَّبَتۡ قَوۡمُ لُوطِۭ بِٱلنُّذُرِ
verses.translation: 33. The people of Lût (Lot) belied the warnings.

verses.arabic_text: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ حَاصِبًا إِلَّآ ءَالَ لُوطٖۖ نَّجَّيۡنَٰهُم بِسَحَرٖ
verses.translation: 34. Verily, We sent against them a violent storm of stones (which destroyed them all), except the family of Lût (Lot), them We saved in the last hour of the night,

verses.arabic_text: نِّعۡمَةٗ مِّنۡ عِندِنَاۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجۡزِي مَن شَكَرَ
verses.translation: 35. As a Favour from Us. Thus do We reward him who gives thanks (by obeying Us).

verses.arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ أَنذَرَهُم بَطۡشَتَنَا فَتَمَارَوۡاْ بِٱلنُّذُرِ
verses.translation: 36. And he [Lût (Lot)] indeed had warned them of Our Seizure (punishment), but they did doubt the warnings!

verses.arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ رَٰوَدُوهُ عَن ضَيۡفِهِۦ فَطَمَسۡنَآ أَعۡيُنَهُمۡ فَذُوقُواْ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
verses.translation: 37. And they indeed sought to shame his guest (by asking to commit sodomy with them). So We blinded their eyes, (saying) "Then taste you My Torment and My Warnings."

verses.arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ صَبَّحَهُم بُكۡرَةً عَذَابٞ مُّسۡتَقِرّٞ
verses.translation: 38. And verily, an abiding torment seized them early in the morning.

verses.arabic_text: فَذُوقُواْ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
verses.translation: 39. "Then taste you My Torment and My Warnings."

verses.arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ يَسَّرۡنَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ لِلذِّكۡرِ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ
verses.translation: 40. And indeed, We have made the Qur’ân easy to understand and remember; then is there any that will remember (or receive admonition)?

verses.arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ جَآءَ ءَالَ فِرۡعَوۡنَ ٱلنُّذُرُ
verses.translation: 41. And indeed, warnings came to the people of Fir‘aun (Pharaoh) [through Mûsâ (Moses) and Hârûn (Aaron)].

verses.arabic_text: كَذَّبُواْ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا كُلِّهَا فَأَخَذۡنَٰهُمۡ أَخۡذَ عَزِيزٖ مُّقۡتَدِرٍ
verses.translation: 42. (They) belied all Our Signs, so We seized them with a Seizure of the All-Mighty, All-Capable (Omnipotent).

verses.arabic_text: أَكُفَّارُكُمۡ خَيۡرٞ مِّنۡ أُوْلَٰٓئِكُمۡ أَمۡ لَكُم بَرَآءَةٞ فِي ٱلزُّبُرِ
verses.translation: 43. Are your disbelievers (O Quraish!) better than these [nations of Nûh (Noah), Lût (Lot), Sâlih, and the people of Fir‘aun (Pharaoh) who were destroyed)? Or have you an immunity (against Our Torment) in the Divine Scriptures?

verses.arabic_text: أَمۡ يَقُولُونَ نَحۡنُ جَمِيعٞ مُّنتَصِرٞ
verses.translation: 44. Or say they: "We are a great multitude, victorious?"

verses.arabic_text: سَيُهۡزَمُ ٱلۡجَمۡعُ وَيُوَلُّونَ ٱلدُّبُرَ
verses.translation: 45. Their multitude will be put to flight, and they will show their backs.

verses.arabic_text: بَلِ ٱلسَّاعَةُ مَوۡعِدُهُمۡ وَٱلسَّاعَةُ أَدۡهَىٰ وَأَمَرُّ
verses.translation: 46. Nay, but the Hour is their appointed time (for their full recompense), and the Hour will be more grievous and more bitter.

verses.arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمِينَ فِي ضَلَٰلٖ وَسُعُرٖ
verses.translation: 47. Verily the Mujrimûn (polytheists, disbelievers, sinners, criminals) are in error (in this world) and will burn (in the Hell-fire in the Hereafter).

verses.arabic_text: يَوۡمَ يُسۡحَبُونَ فِي ٱلنَّارِ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمۡ ذُوقُواْ مَسَّ سَقَرَ
verses.translation: 48. The Day they will be dragged on their faces into the Fire (it will be said to them): "Taste you the touch of Hell!"[1]

verses.arabic_text: إِنَّا كُلَّ شَيۡءٍ خَلَقۡنَٰهُ بِقَدَرٖ
verses.translation: 49. Verily, We have created all things with Qadar (Divine Preordainments of all things before their creation as written in the Book of Decrees Al-Lauh Al-Mahfûz).

verses.arabic_text: وَمَآ أَمۡرُنَآ إِلَّا وَٰحِدَةٞ كَلَمۡحِۭ بِٱلۡبَصَرِ
verses.translation: 50. And Our Commandment is but one as the twinkling of an eye.

verses.arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ أَهۡلَكۡنَآ أَشۡيَاعَكُمۡ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ
verses.translation: 51. And indeed, We have destroyed your likes; then is there any that will remember (or receive admonition)?

verses.arabic_text: وَكُلُّ شَيۡءٖ فَعَلُوهُ فِي ٱلزُّبُرِ
verses.translation: 52. And everything they have done is noted in (their) Records (of deeds).

verses.arabic_text: وَكُلُّ صَغِيرٖ وَكَبِيرٖ مُّسۡتَطَرٌ
verses.translation: 53. And everything, small and big, is written down (in Al-Lauh Al-Mahfûz already beforehand i.e. before it befalls, or is done by its doer: الإيمان بالقدر) (See the Qur’ân V.57:22 and its footnote).

verses.arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّٰتٖ وَنَهَرٖ
verses.translation: 54. Verily, The Muttaqûn (the pious - see V.2:2), will be in the midst of Gardens and Rivers (Paradise).

verses.arabic_text: فِي مَقۡعَدِ صِدۡقٍ عِندَ مَلِيكٖ مُّقۡتَدِرِۭ
verses.translation: 55. In a seat of truth (i.e. Paradise), near the Omnipotent King (Allâh, the One, the All-Blessed, the Most High, the Owner of Majesty and Honour).
